newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: Mayne says has not bid for General de Sante.
newsitem.headline: Mayne says has not bid for General de Sante.

text.p: Australian transport, security and health care group Mayne Nickless Ltd said on Tuesday it had made no formal bid for European hospital operator General de Sante, despite media speculation to the contrary.
"We have not made a bid," a Mayne spokesman told Reuters.

The Sydney Morning Herald and Melbourne's Age newspapers owned by the John Fairfax group said in this morning's editions that Mayne was pressing ahead with a bid worth around A$1 billion and was short-listed along with two management buyout firms BC Partner and Sinven and U.S.-based health giant Columbia .
"Mayne's bid would be funded from the more than A$1 billion that it hopes to get from selling its 24.9 percent stake in Optus Communications," the paper said.
Mayne said in late February that it was interested in the group, a unit of French conglomerate Generale des Eaux which has decided to quit healthcare.
The Mayne spokesman confirmed that the firm continued to examine the Generale de Sante assets but labled the article "supposition."
